required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Role of Faecal Calprotectin in Patients With Abdominal Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Role of Faecal Calprotectin in Patients Presenting to the Emergency Department With Abdominal Pain

lead_sponsor.agency: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS

clinical_study.source: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS

brief_summary.textblock: The evaluation of patients with abdominal pain is a challenge for the emergency physician and the selection of patients for second-level radiological examinations or endoscopic procedures is not always easy to perform. Faecal calprotectin could be a useful diagnostic marker to distinguish between "organic" or "functional" form and its determination could be helpful to select patients for further examinations, in the context of emergency setting.

primary_outcome.description: assess the degree of intestinal inflammation by fecal calprotectin assay in patients with abdominal pain

intervention.description: dosage of calprotectin levels in patients with abdominal pain

study_pop.textblock: patients with abdominal pain and/or diarrhea and/or rectal bleeding accessing the emergency department

facility.name: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario A. Gemelli IRCCS

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS
